settings.custom_liquid:
FOR LOVERS OF JAPANESE TEAS

We offer a selection of the finest Japanese teas that pair perfectly with the content of your gift box.

GOURMET FOODS

Each gift box contains gourmet foods from some of Kyoto's oldest and finest producers.

LIFESTYLE GOODS

We bring you exquisitely crafted Japanese lifestyle goods designed to complement your home and office.

BEAUTIFULLY PRESENTED

Each month's selection comes in a hand-made and beautifully presented gift box exclusive to Mizu Japan customers.

settings.description:
Crane Themed Paper Weight
PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
PRODUCED BY: Kyukyodo

Love at first sight when you behold this in person. A contemporay take on a traditional symbol of Japan, it's never out of place and is a joy to behold

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
PRODUCED BY: A variety of local artisans.

Traditonal Handmade Summer Fan.Due to high demand of these extraordinary limited edition fans, the design of the fan delivered will be dependent on availability at the time of ordering. Thank you for your understanding.

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
PRODUCED BY: Fukui Asahido

A unique collection of Kyoto - World Heritage Bookmarks. Each bookmark has an exquisitely drawn image of a famous Kyoto landmark. Keep them all for yourself or share them with friends and family. Either way they'll be cherished for years to come.

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
LAVOR: Savory
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat, Soy
PRODUCED BY: Buson-an

A declicious collection of traditional rice crackers from a company that still procuces them in the traditional
manner.

*This mochi is called daifuku,
or stuffed mochi. It's flavored
with chocolate and amaou strawberries.
Amaou are grown in Fukuoka
and referred to as ""The King of
Strawberries"" for their delicious taste.*

PRODUCT OF: Tokyo
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat, Milk, Sesame
PRODUCED BY: Azabu Karinto

Deep-fried snacks flavoured with brown sugar. Based in Tokyo, Azabu Karinto is known for the lines of people
that form around the block to savor these delicacies.

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Savory
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: Wheat, Milk
PRODUCED BY: Mametomi Honpo

Kyoto Komamehan Wasabi Pistachios.

These popular wasabi flavored bean sweets are packed with flavor and have a delightful a crunchy texture.

With some green tea, they make a perfect mid-afternoon treat.

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS:None
PRODUCED BY: Crochet

Crochet is a candy store dating back 140-year specializing in traditional Kyoto candy.

Preserving the recipes and techniques handed down to them, Crochet makes their candy 100% by hand.

Koicha-Temari candies have an unforgettable and delighful matcha taste to them.

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS:None
PRODUCED BY: Zarame

Japanese cotton candy from the heart of Kyoto's famous Arashiyama district. Imagine the cotton candy you had as a child and put a Japanese twist on it. Heavenly!

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS:Wheat, Milk, Soy, Eggs
PRODUCED BY: Crochet

Made with high-quality Uji matcha from Kyoto Prefecture, these waffle cookies melt-in-your-mouth. A perfect blend of sweetness and the rich aroma of the finest Uji matcha.

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS:None
PRODUCED BY: Kyo Kaera

Yukidaruma Wasanbon is a premium candy originally produced in Kagawa on the island of Shikoku. It has a 400 years old history and is still very popular today as an adorable confectionary. Savor the refreshing sweetness that is
slowly released.

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Sweet
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS:Soy
PRODUCED BY: Oimatsu

Warabi-mochi is a Japanese sweet made of bracken starch. It is often coated with toasted soybean flour and it has a jelly-like chewy texture.

It is especially popular during the summer season and pairs well with sensha tea.

PRODUCT OF: Kyoto
FLAVOR: Green tea
SUITABLE FOR VEGETARIANS: Yes
COMMON ALLERGENS: N/A
PRODUCED BY: Ippodo

Sen means 'infuse', and sencha is tea that is infused in water. Sencha is consumed warm and at all hours of the day in Japan.

With low levels of caffeine, it can provide a pleasant boost without keeping you up at night.
